text: Ludwig van Beethoven's Piano Sonata No. 29 in B-flat major (also called the Hammerklavier), Op. 106, is a piece of music for solo piano. It was written in 1817 and published in 1818. The sonata was dedicated to Archduke Rudolf. The sonata is 40 to 45 minutes long, the longest of Beethoven's piano sonatas. == Form == The sonata has four movements: == References == Piano Sonata 029 Category:Compositions in B-flat major
title: Piano Sonata No. 29 (Beethoven)
